CatDescriptText: Miss Elnora T. Thomas, 2508 Wylie Avenue, Fifth Ward, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 26, 1957, pg. 4, with question: "Do you believe we should have a state law forbidding strikes of trolley cars, buses, and taxicabs?" answer reads: "Yes, and definitely towards the trolley business. I pay taxes of which the street car company benefits and here I am walking to work or spending a lot of money for taxicabs and other means of transportation.  This is money which I just can't afford.  Since the street car strike, I've been paying about $3 a day for transportation."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Elnora T. Thomas wearing plaid shirt, dark vest, and houndstooth coat with dark trim and buttons, holding dark handbag, standing in front of overgrown lawn with house and small light colored building in background
